title: Software Carpentries Training - Python Workshop
text:
Overview
The Curtin Institute for Data Science hosts Data Carpentry Workshops twice a year to assist in The Carpentries’ mission to build global capacity in essential data and computational skills for research. These workshops aim to provide hands-on teaching and assistance on Git, Python and R to Curtin University researchers and staff.


Python Workshop
This time around, I received the opportunity to re-write the training material for the Python workshop and had the pleasure to instruct with Nancy Tippaya. Many thanks to the helpers involved!



Instructors & Helpers: Calvin Pang, Leigh Tyers, Nancy Tippaya, Christian Proud


The workshop material can be found here.

title: Astrofest 2023
text: Astrofest is an annual event to provide astronomy enthusiasts, families, and the public to explore the mysteries of the Universe. Major sponsors include: Curtin University, International Centre for Radio Astronomy Research, Scitech, CSIRO & Department of Industry, Science and Resources.

title: Astrofest 2023
text: Astrofest is an annual event to provide astronomy enthusiasts, families, and the public to explore the mysteries of the Universe. Major sponsors include: Curtin University, International Centre for Radio Astronomy Research, Scitech, CSIRO & Department of Industry, Science and Resources.

title: Astrofest 2023
text:
ASDAF Booth
The Australian Space Data Analytics Facility (ASDAF) hosted a booth at Astrofest, drawing in a huge crowd! We held colouring in and Lego building competitions for all ages, with Lego prizes up for grabs. I had multiple opportunities to talk to potential STEM students and job seekers about the burgeoning space industry in Western Australia.

title: Data & AI for Business Conference & Exhibition 2023
text: The Data & AI for Business Conference & Exhibition 2023 hosted by WA Data Science Innovation Hub (WADSIH) is a 2-day event which provided an invaluable opportunity to listen to a diverse list of speakers and panellists, all of whom, subject matter experts in their own field.

title: Calvin Pang
text:
About Me
I’m Calvin, a seasoned professional with over seven years experience in conducting digital transformations across academia, government and industry. I am currently working as a Data Scientist, supporting projects for a variety of industries including defence, environmental science, health, mining and space. My specialisations include data visualisation, machine learning engineering, software development and specialist training.
I am also involved in various STEM outreach initiatives in Western Australia, promoting the growth of the data science field.


Work Experience

Data Scientist - Curtin Institute for Data Science
January 2022 - Present


Data Scientist - Australian Space Data Analytics Facility
January 2022 - Present


Sessional Academic - Curtin University
March 2021 - Present

Tutor for Fundamentals of Programming (COMP1005/COMP5005) and Data Structures & Algorithms (COMP1002/COMP5008)



Continuous Improvement Lead - Allied Dental & Centre for Prosthodontics
May 2018 - January 2022


Support Analyst - Kinetic IT
June 2016 - January 2018



Education

Masters of Predictive Analytics - Curtin University


Bachelor of Chemical Engineering - University of Western Australia


Bachelor of Commerce - University of Western Australia

title: 2022 NASA Space Apps Challenge
text: The NASA Space Apps Challenge is a global hackathon to create solutions to challenges we face on Earth and in space. As part of the Curtin Institute for Computation, I competed in a team called the Flat Moon Society in Perth, Western Australia. We came first place in the local selection and received an honorable mention as global finalists.

title: 2022 NASA Space Apps Challenge
text:
Moonquake Emergency Warning System
Our solution, MEWS was the Moonquake Emergency Warning System.

It consists of three main components:

A centralised and standardised database for the storage and dissemination of moonquake data;
A visualisation tool (see demo below) of the 3D moonquake map that we developed to demonstrate the utility of the data as it would be used in one of our apps; and
The Moonquake Emergency Warning System (MEWS), the application of our3D moonquake mapping solution in the form of a three-tiered product that provides targeted information to educators, analysts, and remote operators.

title: WA Health Hackathon 2023
text:
The 2023 Health Hackathon hosted by WA Data Science Innovation Hub (WADSIH) and backed by the Department of Health, Microsoft, Department of WA North Metropolitan Health Service and WA Life Sciences Innovation Hub provides a platform for participants to address six pressing challenges in WA’s healthcare system.

Enhancing the patient flow in Emergency Departments.
Streamlining surgical and operational planning.
Utilising non-health data to optimise Emergency Department operations.
Holistic support for cancer patients through their medical journey.
Integration of AI and machine learning for clinical efficacy.
Revolutionising patient interactions within healthcare processes.

Along with members from the Curtin Machine Learning Club, I competed in the hackathon as “Code Black Bravo” and created ECHO Copilot.



Code Black Bravo: Calvin Pang, Peter Pandellis, Maxwell Morris, Milan Marocchi

title: WA Health Hackathon 2023
text:
The 2023 Health Hackathon hosted by WA Data Science Innovation Hub (WADSIH) and backed by the Department of Health, Microsoft, Department of WA North Metropolitan Health Service and WA Life Sciences Innovation Hub provides a platform for participants to address six pressing challenges in WA’s healthcare system.

Enhancing the patient flow in Emergency Departments.
Streamlining surgical and operational planning.
Utilising non-health data to optimise Emergency Department operations.
Holistic support for cancer patients through their medical journey.
Integration of AI and machine learning for clinical efficacy.
Revolutionising patient interactions within healthcare processes.

Along with members from the Curtin Machine Learning Club, I competed in the hackathon as “Code Black Bravo” and created ECHO Copilot.



Code Black Bravo: Calvin Pang, Peter Pandellis, Maxwell Morris, Milan Marocchi

title: WA Health Hackathon 2023
text:
ECHO Copilot
In emergency healthcare, every second counts, yet clinicians often spend a significant amount of time on administrative tasks, creating detailed clinical records. This leads to burnout, delays in patient care, and a potential for errors in documentation. Additionally, ensuring the integrity and security of patient data remains a challenge.
 Electronic Clinical Health Organiser (ECHO) is a cutting edge application powered by advanced speech recognition and natural language processing technologies. Our system seamlessly converts recorded audio input or scanned text into detailed clinical notes with precision in real-time.
This solution offers numerous benefits: - Time-saving: Reduce administrative burden, allowing doctors and nurses to focus on patient care. - Accuracy: Minimise errors in documentation, ensuring reliable patient records. - Improved Patient Care: Enable healthcare professionals to make faster, informed decisions, enhancing patient outcomes.
